article.headline: Utah State 71, BYU 57
article.story: LOGAN, Utah (AP) -- Nate Harris scored 26 points and Spencer Nelson had 14 points and 11 rebounds in Utah State's 71-57 victory over BYU on Wednesday night. Harris matched his career high by hitting 10 of 13 shots from the field and 6 of 8 from the free-throw line as Utah State improved to 4-1. BYU (1-4) was led by Mike Hall's 19 points, and Austin Ainge added a career-high 15. After a 36-36 tie at the half, the teams traded baskets until two turnovers helped the Aggies take the lead A steal by Nelson and resulting dunk by Harris, followed by a steal by Harris and a basket by Jaycee Carroll gave Utah State a nine-point lead with 6:30 remaining. BYU was then forced to foul and Utah State made 7 of 8 free throws in the game's final minutes to seal the win. Ainge, who had never scored more than six points in a game at BYU, helped the Cougars to a halftime tie with 11 points. Hall, BYU's leading scorer on the year, had 15 at halftime.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
